title: Requires hospitals, nursing homes and community health clinics to provide patient documents in large print format, language assistance services and audio recordings
summary: Requires hospitals, nursing homes and community health clinics to provide patient documents in large print format, language assistance services and audio recordings of pertinent medical information.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          969

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. KELLNER, MAISEL, HEVESI, WEISENBERG, AUBRY, COOK,
         GOTTFRIED,  JAFFEE,  MENG,  PERRY  --  Multi-Sponsored  by -- M. of A.
         GALEF, McDONOUGH, PHEFFER -- read once and referred to  the  Committee
         on Health

       AN  ACT  to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring hospi-
         tals, nursing homes and community health clinics  to  provide  patient
         documents  in  large  print  format,  language assistance services and
         audio recordings of pertinent medical information

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  public health law is amended by adding a new section
    2  2803-t to read as follows:
    3    S 2803-T.  PROVISION  OF  LANGUAGE  ASSISTANCE  TO  VISUALLY  IMPAIRED
    4  PERSONS.  1.  EVERY  GENERAL  HOSPITAL,  NURSING HOME AND DIAGNOSTIC AND
    5  TREATMENT CENTER PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE RANGE OF PRIMARY HEALTH  CARE
    6  SERVICES  SHALL  PROVIDE  LANGUAGE  ASSISTANCE  SERVICES TO A PATIENT OR
    7  PATIENT ASSISTANT SO AS TO ENSURE THAT ALL  PATIENTS  WHO  ARE  VISUALLY
    8  IMPAIRED  AND  UNABLE  TO  READ AND COMPREHEND DOCUMENTS PROVIDED BY THE
    9  FACILITY WITH THE PROFICIENCY NECESSARY FOR ADEQUATE  COMPREHENSION  AND
   10  COMMUNICATION WITH HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS AND OTHER PERSONNEL HAVE EFFEC-
   11  TIVE  ACCESS  TO  THE  PROGRAMS  AND  SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE FACILITY,
   12  INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO HEALTH CARE, BILLING AND APPOINTMENT SCHED-
   13  ULING PROGRAMS AND  SERVICES.  LANGUAGE  ASSISTANCE  SERVICES  SHALL  BE
   14  AVAILABLE  AT ALL LOCATIONS DURING ALL TIMES THAT PATIENT CARE IS AVAIL-
   15  ABLE, AND SHALL, TO THE EXTENT PRACTICABLE, BE PROVIDED IN PERSON.
   16    2. (A) ALL FREQUENTLY USED FORMS, INCLUDING CONSENT FORMS, THE PATIENT
   17  BILL  OF  RIGHTS,  PRE-OPERATIVE  AND  POST-OPERATIVE  INFORMATION   AND
   18  DISCHARGE  INSTRUCTIONS,  AS  WELL  AS  OTHER WRITTEN MATERIALS THAT ARE
   19  ESSENTIAL TO A PATIENT'S CARE AND TREATMENT OR ARE  OTHERWISE  NECESSARY

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00663-01-1

       A. 969                              2

    1  TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE ACCESS TO THE FACILITY'S SERVICES SHALL BE AVAILABLE
    2  IN LARGE PRINT FORMAT.
    3    (B)  EVERY  FACILITY SHALL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE
    4  PLAN THAT ESTABLISHES UNIFORM  POLICIES  AND  PROCEDURES  FOR  PROVIDING
    5  LANGUAGE  ASSISTANCE  SERVICES  TO VISUALLY IMPAIRED PATIENTS, INCLUDING
    6  PROCEDURES FOR DOCUMENTING THE PROVISION OF,  OR  REFUSAL  OF,  LANGUAGE
    7  ASSISTANCE SERVICES. FACILITY PERSONNEL SHALL BE AVAILABLE TO READ WRIT-
    8  TEN DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING PATIENT-SPECIFIC AND NON-PATIENT-SPECIFIC DOCU-
    9  MENTS,  TO  ANY  PATIENT OR PATIENT ASSISTANT WHO IS UNABLE TO READ SUCH
   10  DOCUMENTS DUE TO VISUAL IMPAIRMENT AND WHO REQUESTS SUCH  SERVICES,  AND
   11  TO  RESPOND  TO QUESTIONS CONCERNING SUCH DOCUMENTS. UPON REQUEST BY THE
   12  PATIENT OR PATIENT ASSISTANT, ALL SUCH CONVERSATIONS MAY BE RECORDED AND
   13  AN AUDIO RECORDING OF ALL CONVERSATIONS SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE  TO  THE
   14  PATIENT OR PATIENT ASSISTANT.
   15    3.  THE  STATEMENTS  REGARDING  PATIENT  RIGHTS  AND  RESPONSIBILITIES
   16  REQUIRED PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (G) OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF  SECTION  TWEN-
   17  TY-EIGHT  HUNDRED THREE AND SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED THREE-C OF THIS
   18  ARTICLE SHALL INCLUDE A PROVISION NOTIFYING PATIENTS OF THE AVAILABILITY
   19  OF LARGE PRINT FORMAT DOCUMENTS AND LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE SERVICE.  NOTICE
   20  OF THE AVAILABILITY OF LARGE PRINT FORMAT DOCUMENTS AND LANGUAGE ASSIST-
   21  ANCE  SERVICES  SHALL  BE POSTED IN CONSPICUOUS LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT ALL
   22  AREAS OF THE FACILITY THAT ARE ACCESSIBLE TO PATIENTS.
   23    4. EVERY FACILITY SHALL SUBMIT TO THE COMMISSIONER  AN  ANNUAL  REPORT
   24  ASSESSING  ITS  COMPLIANCE  WITH  THE  REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION. THE
   25  REPORT SHALL IDENTIFY THE MEASURES TAKEN BY THE FACILITY  IN  COMPLIANCE
   26  WITH  THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION AND THE PERCENTAGE OF THE FACILI-
   27  TY'S PATIENTS WHO UTILIZE SUCH ASSISTANCE.
   28    5. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS AS MAY
   29  BE NECESSARY AND PROPER TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   30    6. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "PATIENT  ASSISTANT"  SHALL  MEAN  AN
   31  INDIVIDUAL  WHO COMMUNICATES ON BEHALF OF ANOTHER WHO, BY REASON OF AGE,
   32  INCAPACITY OR VISUAL  IMPAIRMENT,  CANNOT  COMMUNICATE  FOR  HIMSELF  OR
   33  HERSELF.
   34    7.  NOTHING  IN  THIS  SECTION  SHALL PRECLUDE MEDICAL FACILITIES FROM
   35  PROVIDING LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE SERVICES IN  ADDITION  TO  THOSE  REQUIRED
   36  UNDER THIS SECTION.
   37    S 2. Subdivision 1 of section 2803 of the public health law is amended
   38  by adding a new paragraph (k) to read as follows:
   39    (K)  THE  STATEMENT  REGARDING  PATIENT  RIGHTS  AND RESPONSIBILITIES,
   40  REQUIRED PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (G) OF THIS SUBDIVISION, SHALL INCLUDE  A
   41  PROVISION  NOTIFYING  PATIENTS OF THE AVAILABILITY OF LARGE PRINT FORMAT
   42  DOCUMENTS AND LANGUAGE ASSISTANCE SERVICES IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH  SECTION
   43  TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED THREE-T OF THIS ARTICLE.
   44    S  3.  Subdivision  3  of  section  2803-c of the public health law is
   45  amended by adding a new paragraph q to read as follows:
   46    Q. A STATEMENT NOTIFYING PATIENTS OF THE AVAILABILITY OF  LARGE  PRINT
   47  FORMAT  DOCUMENTS  AND  LANGUAGE  ASSISTANCE SERVICES IN ACCORDANCE WITH
   48  SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED THREE-T OF THIS ARTICLE.
   49    S 4. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   50  it shall have become a law; provided  that  effective  immediately,  the
   51  commissioner  of health is authorized to promulgate such rules and regu-
   52  lations as may be necessary and proper to implement  the  provisions  of
   53  this act.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to requiring hospitals, nursing homes and community health clinics to provide patient documents in large print format, language assistance services and audio recordings of pertinent medical information
